member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.AsyncContentLoadedState
member.summary: Contains values that specify the state of the content being loaded into a content element.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.AsyncContentLoadedState.Beginning
member.summary: Specifies that asynchronous loading of the content into the UI Automation element is beginning.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.AsyncContentLoadedState.Completed
member.summary: Specifies that asynchronous loading of the content into the UI Automation element is complete.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.AsyncContentLoadedState.Progress
member.summary: Specifies that asynchronous loading of the content into the UI Automation element is in progress. UI Automation providers should specify the percent complete so that client applications will know how much more content remains.

member.summary: Identifies a list control, such as a list box.

member.summary: Identifies a menu control, such as a top-level menu in an application window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.MenuBar
member.summary: Identifies a menu bar control, which generally contains a set of top-level menus.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.MenuItem
member.summary: Identifies a menu item control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Pane
member.summary: Identifies a pane control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ProgressBar
member.summary: Identifies a progress bar control, which visually indicates the progress of a lengthy operation.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.RadioButton
member.summary: Identifies a radio button control, which is a selection mechanism allowing exactly one selected item in a group.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ScrollBar
member.summary: Identifies a scroll bar control, such as a scroll bar in an application window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Separator
member.summary: Identifies a separator, which creates a visual division in controls like menus and toolbars.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Slider
member.summary: Identifies a slider control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Spinner
member.summary: Identifies a spinner control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.SplitButton
member.summary: Identifies a split button, which is a button that performs a default action and can also expand to a list of other possible actions.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.StatusBar
member.summary: Identifies a status bar control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Tab
member.summary: Identifies a tab control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.TabItem
member.summary: Identifies a tab item control, which represents a page of a tab control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Table
member.summary: Identifies a table.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Text
member.summary: Identifies an edit control, such as a text box or rich text box.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Thumb
member.summary: Identifies the control in a scrollbar that can be dragged to a different position.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.TitleBar
member.summary: Identifies the caption bar on a window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ToolBar
member.summary: Identifies a toolbar, such as the control that contains a set of command buttons in an application window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.ToolTip
member.summary: Identifies a tooltip control, an informational window that appears as a result of moving the pointer over a control or sometimes when tabbing to a control using the keyboard.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Tree
member.summary: Identifies a tree control.

member.summary: Identifies a node in a control.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ControlType.Window
member.summary: Identifies a window frame, which contains child objects.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition
member.summary: Contains values that specify the dock position of an object, represented by a , within a docking container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.Bottom
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is docked along the bottom edge of the docking container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.Fill
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is docked along all edges of the docking container and fills all available space within the container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.Left
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is docked along the left edge of the docking container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.None
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is not docked to any edge of the docking container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.Right
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is docked along the right edge of the docking container.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition.Top
member.summary: Indicates that the UI Automation element is docked along the top edge of the docking container.

member.summary: Some, but not all, child nodes, controls, or content of the UI Automation element are displayed.

member.summary: Specifies that data in the table should be read column by column.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount
member.summary: Contains values used by to indicate the direction and distance to scroll.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is done in large decrements, equivalent to PageUp or clicking on a blank part of a scrollbar. If PageUp is not a relevant amount for the control and/or no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the current visible window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is done in large increments, equivalent to a PageDown or clicking on the track of a scrollbar component. If a PageDown is not a relevant amount for the control and/or no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the current visible region.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount.NoAmount
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling should not be performed.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is done in small decrements, equivalent to pressing an arrow key or clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is done in small increments, equivalent to pressing an arrow key or clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the event that is raised when the UI Automation tree structure has changed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the type of change and the identifier (ID) of the element whose structure changed.
member.param: A single value that specifies the type of change.
The runtime identifier (ID) of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs.GetRuntimeId
member.summary: Retrieves the UI Automation runtime identifier (ID) of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.
member.returns: The runtime ID of the UI Automation element whose structure changed.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventArgs.StructureChangeType
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the type of change that occurred in the UI Automation tree structure.
member.returns: The type of changed that occurred.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method implemented by the client application to handle the event raised when the UI Automation tree structure has changed.
member.param: The object that raised the event.
Information about the event.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType
member.summary: Contains values that specify changes in the structure of the Microsoft UI Automation element tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildAdded
member.summary: A child element was added to the UI Automation element tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildRemoved
member.summary: A child element was removed from the UI Automation element tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkAdded
member.summary: Child elements were added to the UI Automation element tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildrenBulkRemoved
member.summary: Child elements were removed from the UI Automation element tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildrenInvalidated
member.summary: Child elements were invalidated in the UI Automation element tree. This might mean that one or more children were added or removed, depending on the UI Automation providers implementation.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.StructureChangeType.ChildrenReordered
member.summary: The order of the child elements in the UI Automation element tree changed.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.SupportedTextSelection
member.summary: Contains values that specify whether a text provider supports selection and, if so, whether it supports a single, continuous selection or multiple, disjoint selections.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.SupportedTextSelection.Multiple
member.summary: Supports multiple, disjoint text selections.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.SupportedTextSelection.None
member.summary: Does not support text selections.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.SupportedTextSelection.Single
member.summary: Supports a single, continuous text selection.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle
member.summary: Represents values for .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.BlinkingBackground
member.summary: Specifies that the font and background alternate between assigned colors and contrasting colors.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.LasVegasLights
member.summary: Specifies that the bounding rectangle displays a border of alternating icons of different colors.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.MarchingBlackAnts
member.summary: Specifies that the bounding rectangle displays moving black dashes.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.MarchingRedAnts
member.summary: Specifies that the bounding rectangle displays moving red dashes.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.None
member.summary: Specifies that there is no animation style.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.Other
member.summary: Specifies that the animation style is one not explicitly itemized in the enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.Shimmer
member.summary: Specifies that the font alternates between solid and blurred.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.SparkleText
member.summary: Specifies that the background displays flashing, multi-colored icons.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle
member.summary: Values for .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.DashBullet
member.summary: Dash bullets.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.FilledRoundBullet
member.summary: Solid round bullets.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.FilledSquareBullet
member.summary: Solid square bullets.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.HollowRoundBullet
member.summary: Hollow round bullets.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.HollowSquareBullet
member.summary: Hollow square bullets.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.None
member.summary: No bullet style.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.Other
member.summary: Another bullet style not explicitly specified in the enumeration.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle
member.summary: Represents values for .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.AllCap
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is all caps; all lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.AllPetiteCaps
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is all petite caps; uppercase and lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters slightly smaller than small caps.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.None
member.summary: Indicates that there is no capitalization style; uppercase and lowercase letters render normally.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.Other
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is a style not explicitly specified in the enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.PetiteCaps
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is petite caps; lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters slightly smaller than small caps.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.SmallCap
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is small caps; lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters of the same approximate height as the font's x-height.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.Titling
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is title case; uppercase and lowercase letters are rendered with letters specifically designed for titles.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.Unicase
member.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is unicase; uppercase and lowercase letters are rendered in a way determined by the type designer. A unicase alphabet is one that does not specify case for its letters.

member.summary: Identifies the of the UI Automation element.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState
member.summary: Contains values that specify the of a UI Automation element.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState.Indeterminate
member.summary: The UI Automation element is in an indeterminate state. can be used to indicate whether the user has acted on a control. For example, a check box can appear checked and dimmed, indicating an indeterminate state. Creating an indeterminate state is different from disabling the control. Consequently, a check box in the indeterminate state can still receive the focus. When the user clicks an indeterminate control, the cycles to its next value.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState.Off
member.summary: The UI Automation element is not selected, checked, marked, or otherwise activated.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState.On
member.summary: The UI Automation element is selected, checked, marked, or otherwise activated.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope
member.summary: Contains values that specify the scope of elements within the UI Automation tree.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Ancestors
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the element's ancestors, including the parent. Not supported.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Children
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the element's immediate children.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Descendants
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the element's descendants, including children.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Element
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the element itself.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Parent
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the element's parent. Not supported.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.TreeScope.Subtree
member.summary: Specifies that the search include the root of the search and all descendants.

member.summary: Contains information about the event that is raised when a window is closed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.WindowClosedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The runtime identifier of the window that has closed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Automation.WindowClosedEventArgs.GetRuntimeId
member.summary: Retrieves the UI Automation runtime identifier (ID) associated with this event.
member.returns: The UI Automation runtime ID of the window on which the event was raised.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState
member.summary: Contains values that specify the current state of the window for purposes of user or programmatic interaction.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState.BlockedByModalWindow
member.summary: Indicates that the window is blocked by a modal window.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState.Closing
member.summary: Indicates that the window is closing.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState.NotResponding
member.summary: Indicates that the window is not responding.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState.ReadyForUserInteraction
member.summary: Indicates that the window is ready for user interaction.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Automation.WindowInteractionState.Running
member.summary: Indicates that the window is running. This does not guarantee that the window is responding or ready for user interaction.
